X : Y`, `for`, `while`; functions `function f(x) end`, anonymous `x -> x^2`, arrays `[1, 2, 3]`, slicing `a[1:2]`, tuples `(1, 2)`, namedtuples `(; name="Julia", )`, dictionary `Dict("key" => value)`, `$` for string interpolation. 
- Prefer Julia standard libraries, avoid new packages unless explicitly requested.

# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = collect(str)
    new_lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for i in eachindex(words)
        if length(current_line) + length(words[i]) > text_width
            push!(new_lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line += words[i]
    end
    push!(new_lines, current_line) # Add the last line
    return join(new_lines) * "\n"
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello World This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped at Hello World This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped at text width 10.", 10)
"Hello World\nThis is a very long string that needs to be wrapped at Hello World\nThis is a very long string that needs to be wrapped at text width 10."
```
